comments:
Build ID: I20070517-1700

Steps To Reproduce:
I got an NPE by doing the following, but could not reproduce later. If the stack-trace is helpful, great. If not, feel free to close the bug.

1. Press CTRL-SHIFT-R on a method (in my case it was named setAllNewsStateWithEquiUpdateAndloadAllNews).
2. For some reason the selection of the in-line rename does not include the full method.
3. Delete a few letters anyway and press Enter.
4. Operation fails and NPE is thrown.

More information:
Unhandled event loop exception

org.eclipse.swt.SWTException: Failed to execute runnable (java.lang.NullPointerException)
	at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:3547)

Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.corext.refactoring.rename.MethodChecks.isVirtual(MethodChecks.java:46)

It's hard to tell what brought the editor into this state, but it looks like the Java Model was not correctly reconciled with the editor. Since we explicitly reconcile just before accessing the model, I don't see how this can happen.

Closing for now. Please reopen if you see this again and have more information about the problem (e.g. log entries that occurred just before).
